pr_title: [JENKINS-57841] Change defaults for command and args

timeline.message: [JENKINS-57841] Change defaults for command and args for Container Template. Document Windows defaults in the help.

timeline.author: jglick

replies.bodyText: Habit I guess. I guess with the other change it's not necessary.
replies.author: kerogers-cloudbees

replies.bodyText: In fact it is wrong: if you are going to mark it at all, it should be @Nonnull (or @NonNull depending on the package imported).
replies.author: jglick

timeline.author: jglick

timeline.bodyText:
Change the default to be false in this case. The only reason for tty: true was to pair with cat. IOW
cat
with no input, but with a TTY (so no EOF), is just an idiom for sleeping.
timeline.author: jglick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,11 +23,11 @@
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="command" title="${%Command to run}">
-    <f:textbox default="/bin/sh -c"/>
+    <f:textbox default="${descriptor.defaultCommand}"/>
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="args" title="${%Arguments to pass to the command}">
-    <f:textbox default="cat"/>
+    <f:textbox default="${descriptor.defaultArgs}"/>
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="ttyEnabled" title="${%Allocate pseudo-TTY}">

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change

For Windows containers 'powershell' is a good default.

For Windows containers powershell is a good default.
timeline.author: jglick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1 +1,2 @@ -Override the image entrypoint with a different one \ No newline at end of file +

Override the image entrypoint with a different one.

+

For Windows containers 'powershell' is a good default.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change

For Windows containers the args ["Start-Sleep", "999999"] are reasonable choices to go with powershell.

For Windows containers the args Start-Sleep 999999 are reasonable choices to go with powershell.

I guess? The field is of type String not List.
timeline.author: jglick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,2 +1,3 @@ -Arguments to pass to the command. -${computer.jnlpmac} and ${computer.name} are replaced with the agent secret and name respectively. +

Arguments to pass to the command.

+

${computer.jnlpmac} and ${computer.name} are replaced with the agent secret and name respectively.

+

For Windows containers the args ["Start-Sleep", "999999"] are reasonable choices to go with powershell.

replies.bodyText: I think kubernetes is expecting a string that looks like a list. https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/
replies.author: kerogers-cloudbees
jglick

timeline.author: schottsfired

replies.bodyText: I'll test it to see if jelly is doing some sort of transformation, and change it if not.
replies.author: kerogers-cloudbees

replies.bodyText: Jelly does not have different rules.
replies.author: jglick

timeline.message: [JENKINS-57841] changes from review. more to come.
[JENKINS-57841] Use the normal java style conventions for final static strings.
[JENKINS-57841] Reverting the defaults out of the java class. Changing the defaults in the jelly file. Also updating the examples to reflect the changes.

timeline.bodyText:
Do we want to be consistent?

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                command: ['sleep']
          
          
            
                args: ['9999999']
          
          
            
                command:
          
          
            
                - sleep
          
          
            
                args:
          
          
            
                - 9999999
timeline.author: jglick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,8 +13,8 @@ spec:
     tty: true
   - name: golang
     image: golang:1.8.0
-    command: ['cat']
-    tty: true
+    command: ['sleep']
+    args: ['9999999']

replies.bodyText: yes, consistency is better. Should have caught that on my own.
replies.author: kerogers-cloudbees

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                    ttyEnabled false
          
      
    
    
  

since the default if false right?
timeline.author: jglick
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5,8 +5,9 @@ pipeline {
       containerTemplate {
         name 'maven'
         image 'maven:3.3.9-jdk-8-alpine'
-        ttyEnabled true
-        command 'cat'
+        ttyEnabled false

timeline.bodyText:
just
git checkout master -- src/main/java/org/csanchez/jenkins/plugins/kubernetes/ContainerTemplate.java
to revert irrelevant changes
timeline.author: jglick

timeline.message: [JENKINS-57841] Make yaml more consistent. remove unnecessary properties.

timeline.bodyText: typo: does talse evaluate to false anyway?
timeline.author: sbeaulie
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -23,15 +23,15 @@
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="command" title="${%Command to run}">
-    <f:textbox default="/bin/sh -c"/>
+    <f:textbox default="sleep"/>
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="args" title="${%Arguments to pass to the command}">
-    <f:textbox default="cat"/>
+    <f:textbox default="9999999"/>
   </f:entry>
 
   <f:entry field="ttyEnabled" title="${%Allocate pseudo-TTY}">
-    <f:checkbox default="true"/>
+    <f:checkbox default="talse"/>

replies.bodyText:
Good catch: #957

does talse evaluate to false anyway?

I think so, yes. For that matter, it is the default for the default.
replies.author: jglick
